basics.name: Jaeden Chang
basics.label: Computer Engineering Student
basics.summary: I am studying for a B.S. in Computer Engineering  at the University of Hawaii at Manoa. I expect to graduate in Spring, 2024.

volunteer.organization: HKN, UH Manoa CoE ECE Department
volunteer.summary: Tutor for Electrical and Computer Engineering Students
highlights: Assist underclassmen engineering students with homework and classwork for 100/200 level electrical engineering courses
Participate in various engineering-related service projects across Oahu

volunteer.organization: HKN, UH Manoa CoE ECE Department
volunteer.summary: Vice President of Eta Kappa Nu, Delta Omega Chapter
highlights: HKN main point of contact for day-to-day operations and internal affairs
Assumes the role and responsibilities of the HKN President in their absence
Coordinates with the President and other officers on HKN, College of Engineering, outreach, community service, and social events
Primary Responsibilities: Blueprints, Holmescoming, and Induction Ceremony

volunteer.organization: IEEE Executive Board, UH Manoa CoE
volunteer.summary: Head of Student Advisory Board Club
highlights: Manage the Student Advisory Board Club. The Student Advisory Board Club is a club that listens to the CENG/EE student's concerns or needs, and brainstorm solutions to solve them.
Represent the different class standings and tracks of the Electrical and Computer Engineering department of the College of Engineering at UH Manoa.
Be the bridge to communicate and assist with student concerns and suggestions to faculty and industry partners.
Help improve classes, labs, ECE department etc.

volunteer.organization: IEEE Executive Board, UH Manoa CoE
volunteer.summary: IEEE Webmaster for UH Manoa CoE
highlights: Maintain and update the club's main website and social media account
Maintain the club email list and organize the club's google drive materials

volunteer.organization: Smart Campus Energy Lab, UH Manoa
highlights: Collaborated with a team of engineering students to develop an environmental sensor network to aid in short term forecasting of renewable energy generation across the UH Manoa campus.
Program and maintain firmware of sensor modules in C++ and conduct version control with Git/Github.
Develop server-side code in Python to facilitate storage and handling of acquired environmental data.
Assist hardware teams with debugging of both software and hardware issues.

volunteer.summary: Micro VIP Impedance Analyzer Team Member
highlights: Collaborated with a team of engineering students to create an inexpensive impedance analyzer for cells.
Performed hand-calculated analysis of cellular systems to produce theoretical baselines for research.
Used COMSOL Multiphysics to model and simulate electrical responses of proposed designs.
Implemented proposed impedance analyzer circuit and collected data using the Hioki IM3570.

awards.title: UH Manoa Regents Scholar
awards.summary: Regents Scholarships are awarded to 20 outstanding freshmen who receive an SAT total score of at least 1340 or ACT combined score of at least 29, maintain at least a 3.5 GPA in academic subjects in high school, and whose extracurricular achievements are shown to be remarkable. Regents Scholars receive a full tuition waiver for four years of undergraduate study, $4,000 a year ($2000 per semester), and a one-time travel grant of $2,000.

awards.title: UH Manoa Dean's List
awards.awarder: University of Hawaii College of Engineering
awards.summary: Undergraduate students are awarded the Dean's List distinction when they have earned a semester GPA of 3.5 or higher and were enrolled in 12 or more credits for a grade, excluding CR/NC (credit/no credit), W (withdrawn), I (incomplete), F (failure) grades for the semester.
